Project

Building a 100% electric race prototype

The project delivers a 100% electric prototype capable of competing at MotorLand Aragón in October 2027.

Electric category

MotoStudent

MotorLand Aragón

Alcañiz, Spain

Objectives

Race-ready for October 2027

We are engineering a competitive electric motorcycle that meets MotoStudent technical requirements and performs reliably at MotorLand Aragón.

Timeline highlights: design validation now; build and testing through 2027; final event Oct 2027.

Technical focus areas

Systems in development

Powertrain

Motor & inverter

Our goal this year is to perfect the motor and inverter design to pump the last remaining performance gains. This means tuning the inverter's control algorithms so that we can push the motor to its maximum efficiency and power output, getting as close as possible to the thermal limit of the motor.

Energy

Battery pack

Last year we designed a battery pack with the latest and highest performance battery technology. For 2027 we aim to update the pack to new generation cells and improve the tuning of our custom active balancing BMS.

Chassis

Frame & dynamics

Controls

Vehicle control

For 2027 we are working on designing our own ECU to control all vehicle systems and ensure optimal performance and easy customization.

Validation

Testing & telemetry

The bike for 2025 had new sensors and telemetry systems to support data-driven development and performance tuning. For 2027 we are planning on adding more sensors and integrating their data in the vehicle's control system to improve performance and reliability.

Cooling

Cooling system design

Aerodynamics

Fairing design and optimisation

Roadmap

Key milestones

  • Design & validation

    In progress. System architecture, analysis, supplier alignment

  • Build & integration

    2026-2027 : Manufacturing, assembly, subsystem testing

  • Track testing

    2027 : Performance tuning and reliability

  • Final event

    Oct 2027 : MotorLand Aragon!
